title: How the Ukrainian army is standing up to Russia: 'Still being here four years after the attack is a victory'
subhead: Since the start of the Russian invasion in February 2022, Kyiv's troops have particularly relied on individual initiative and innovation to hold back Moscow's advance, despite a stark disparity in human and material resources.

title: Trump imposes 10% global tariff after stinging court rebuke
After Uganda's post-election crackdown, authorities are targeting the last remaining opposition figures
'In Minneapolis, ICE encountered a political history strong enough to generate a real balance of power'
subhead: The ability to withstand repression without weakening protest is a distinctive feature of Minnesota's political culture, writes historian Darius Devos for Le Monde.

title: CEO of Mistral AI says warnings about extreme risks of artificial intelligence are often 'distraction tactics'
subhead: Arthur Mensch stands out for his views on the risks posed by artificial intelligence, which have been voiced by OpenAI CEO Sam Altman and Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei.

title: US freeskier Ferreira wins halfpipe gold: 'I'm finally in the history books'
subhead: 31-year-old Alex Ferreira won halfpipe silver at the 2018 Pyeongchang Games and followed up with bronze in Beijing four years later.

title: Lyon mayoral election: Who's running?
subhead: Here are the six leading candidates most likely to win the mayoralty in Lyon, France's third-largest city, in the municipal elections on March 15 and 22.

In legendary Swiss village of Sils-Maria, the Chesa Marchetta hotel blends art with the art of living
subhead: Gallerists Iwan and Manuela Wirth chose the Swiss canton of Grisons to open their second location. They entrusted the restoration of this former mountain inn to architect Luis Laplace, who took care to remain faithful to the rustic spirit of the place while punctuating it with works of art.

title: Former prince Andrew arrested for several hours by police in historic event for the UK
subhead: The late Queen Elizabeth II's favorite son was taken in for questioning on February 19, possibly in connection with the Epstein case. This is the first time in modern British history that a member of the royal family has been placed in police custody.

title: Real or faux, vintage or new, fur is no longer hiding
subhead: Even though imitation now dominates the market, secondhand pieces made from real fur are once again in high demand, as are sheepskin and lambskin. According to animal rights advocates, these alternatives still fuel the desire for materials that should be banned.

title: 'The French economy is paradoxically experiencing a renewed sense of optimism'

'The fall of the cumbersome Jack Lang is seen as providential for France's political spectrum, which remains paralyzed by his cultural legacy'
